document.docAuthor: Shamshev, Igor V., Sinclair, Bradley J. & Khruleva, Olga A.
document.masterDocTitle: The empidoid flies (Diptera: Empidoidea, exclusive of Dolichopodidae) of the Russian Arctic islands and Svalbard Archipelago

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The empidoid flies (Diptera: Empidoidea, exclusive of Dolichopodidae) of the Russian Arctic islands and Svalbard Archipelago

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Rhamphomyia albopilosa Coquillett, 1900: 418
. Type-locality: Berg Bay, Alaska , USA .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Other references:

( lectotype designation, redescription, full list of references).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

. Type-locality: Baldy Mtn., Colorado , USA .

subSubSection.paragraph:

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Rhamphomyia ( Dasyrhamphomyia ) wuorentausi Frey, 1922: 67
. Type-locality: Dudinka, Krasnoyarskiy Territory, Russia .

subSubSection.paragraph:

(synonym, lectotype designation).

Distribution. Holarctic; in North America,
R . albopilosa
is widespread across the low arctic, with isolated southern records (
Sinclair et al . 2019
). In Eurasia, the species occurs in Eastern and Western Siberia ( Shamshev 2016 ). Among the Russian Arctic islands,
R . albopilosa
is known only from Wrangel Island.
Habitat. On Wrangel Island this species is found in various biotopes.
